required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Exploration of the Predictive Marker and Establishment of Predictive Models of Checkpoint Inhibitor Pneumonitis
clinical_study.official_title: Exploration of Predictive Markers and Establishment of Predictive Models for Checkpoint Inhibitor Pneumonitis in Combination With Imaging in Immune Checkpoint Inhibitor Therapy

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital Xi'an Jiaotong University

collaborator.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Zhengzhou University

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital Xi'an Jiaotong University

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, multicenter observational study to explore the predictive factors of checkpoint inhibitor pneumonitis (CIP) and to establish predictive models by combining imaging information for IRP. The imaging type of CIP, the pathological type, various inflammatory cytokines and tumor proportion score(TPS) of PD-L1 expression level, etc. will be paid more attention.

detailed_description.textblock:
Prospective dual-arm, multicenter observational study to explore the predictive factors of checkpoint inhibitor pneumonitis (CIP) and to establish predictive models by combining imaging information.Patients will receive work-up, treatment and follow-up exclusively as routinely done except monitoring and evaluation of CIP. Necessary tests will be required, such as lung function tests, lymphocyte subsets, and thin-section CT of the chest during evaluation of the disease.This study mainly included patients with malignant tumor who received immune checkpoint inhibitors for the first time.Fasting venous blood was taken before treatment and before cycle 3,5...2n+1 of treatment. Then the blood samples were centrifuged and frozen in a refrigerator at -80℃ for later mass spectrometry analysis. IrAEs of patients was strictly recorded according to CommonTerminology Criteria Adverse Events V4.0 (CTCAE V4.0). The main objective was to explore the relationship between various indicators and the occurrence of CIP, including pulmonary ventilation and diffusion function at baseline, C-reative protein(CRP), cytokines, interleukin-6(IL-6), CD4+ T lymphocyte count and percentage, CD8+ T lymphocyte count and percentage, NK cell count and percentage, total T lymphocyte count and percentage, neutrophil counts and percentages, eosinophilic cell count and percentage, white blood cell count, blood platelet count, serum albumin(ALB), alanine aminotransferase(ALT), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), γ-glutamyl transpeptadase（γ-GGT), body mass index (BMI), serum procalcitonin(PCT), smoking index and various inflammatory cytokines.
Primary study endpoints: The predictive factors and the predictive models of CIP.
Secondary study endpoints: The incidence and clinical characteristics of CIP.

primary_outcome.measure: The change of C reactive protein(CRP); mg/L
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Cycle 1,3, 5, 7 and 2n+1(each cycle is 21 days) and through study completion, an average of 6 months.
primary_outcome.description: CRP level in the serum.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Cycle 1,3, 5, 7 and 2n+1(each cycle is 21 days) and through study completion, an average of 6 months.
primary_outcome.description: IL-6 level in the serum.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Cycle 1,3, 5, 7 and 2n+1(each cycle is 21 days) and through study completion, an average of 6 months.
primary_outcome.description: The absolute and relative counts of CD4+ T lymphocyte in whole blood.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Cycle 1,3, 5, 7 and 2n+1(each cycle is 21 days) and through study completion, an average of 6 months.
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of CD4+ T lymphocyte in whole blood.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Cycle 1,3, 5, 7 and 2n+1(each cycle is 21 days) and through study completion, an average of 6 months.
primary_outcome.description: The absolute and relative counts of CD8+ T lymphocyte in whole blood.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Cycle 1,3, 5, 7 and 2n+1(each cycle is 21 days) and through study completion, an average of 6 months.
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of CD8+ T lymphocyte in whole blood.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Cycle 1,3, 5, 7 and 2n+1(each cycle is 21 days) and through study completion, an average of 6 months.
primary_outcome.description: The absolute and relative counts of NK cell in whole blood.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Cycle 1,3, 5, 7 and 2n+1(each cycle is 21 days) and through study completion, an average of 6 months.
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of NK cell in whole blood.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Cycle 1,3, 5, 7 and 2n+1(each cycle is 21 days) and through study completion, an average of 6 months.
primary_outcome.description: The white blood cell count in whole blood.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Cycle 1,3, 5, 7 and 2n+1(each cycle is 21 days) and through study completion, an average of 6 months.
primary_outcome.description: The absolute and relative counts of total lymphocyte count in whole blood.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Cycle 1,3, 5, 7 and 2n+1(each cycle is 21 days) and through study completion, an average of 6 months.
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of total lymphocyte count in whole blood.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Cycle 1,3, 5, 7 and 2n+1(each cycle is 21 days) and through study completion, an average of 6 months.
primary_outcome.description: The absolute and relative counts of eosinophils count in whole blood.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Cycle 1,3, 5, 7 and 2n+1(each cycle is 21 days) and through study completion, an average of 6 months.
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of eosinophils count in whole blood.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Cycle 1,3, 5, 7 and 2n+1(each cycle is 21 days) and through study completion, an average of 6 months.
primary_outcome.description: The blood platelet count in whole blood.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Cycle 1,3, 5, 7 and 2n+1(each cycle is 21 days) and through study completion, an average of 6 months.
primary_outcome.description: The ALT level in the serum.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Cycle 1,3, 5, 7 and 2n+1(each cycle is 21 days) and through study completion, an average of 6 months.
primary_outcome.description: The AST level in the serum.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Cycle 1,3, 5, 7 and 2n+1(each cycle is 21 days) and through study completion, an average of 6 months.
primary_outcome.description: The albumin level in the serum.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Cycle 1,3, 5, 7 and 2n+1(each cycle is 21 days) and through study completion, an average of 6 months.
primary_outcome.description: The γ-GGT level in the serum.

primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline
primary_outcome.description: The average root number per day multiplied by smoking years of smoking, that is, smoking index.

primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline
primary_outcome.description: The body's weight(Kg) divided by the square of your height(m), that is, body mass index.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Cycle 1,3, 5, 7 and 2n+1(each cycle is 21 days) and through study completion, an average of 6 months.
primary_outcome.description: The PCT level in the serum.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Cycle 1.
primary_outcome.description: The maximum amount of air that can be exhaled as soon as possible after the maximum inhalation. FVC was used to evaluate pulmonary ventilation function.

primary_outcome.measure: Forced the first second of expiratory volume (FEV1); L
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Cycle 1.
primary_outcome.description: the first second of exhalation during the maximum exhalation after the maximum deep inhalation. FEV1 was used to evaluate pulmonary ventilation function.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Cycle 1.
primary_outcome.description: FEV1 accounts for the percentage of FVC. FEV1/FVC was used to evaluate pulmonary ventilation function.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Cycle 1.
primary_outcome.description: The average flow rate with forced exhalation of 25% to 75% of lung capacity. FEV1/FVC was used to evaluate pulmonary ventilation function.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before Cycle 1.
primary_outcome.description: FeNO measurement quantified the amount of nitric oxide (NO) in one's exhaled breath, which was used to evaluate pulmonary diffusion function.

secondary_outcome.description: The incidence of IRP in the general population receiving ICIs

arm_group.description: Patients receiving ICIs for the first time

intervention.description: Patients with malignant tumors who first received ICIs

biospec_descr.textblock: Fasting venous blood was drawn from patients who first received immune checkpoint inhibitors therapy before baseline and before cycle 3，5...2n+1.Then the blood samples were centrifuged and frozen in a refrigerator at -80℃ for later mass spectrometry analysis.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with malignant tumor receiving immune checkpoint inhibitors for the first time.

overall_official.affiliation: First Affiliated Hospital Xi'an Jiaotong University
